column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

A mild start to the morning along with handy grass land conditions plus ample rainfall in the eastern high country over the last 7 days saw Scone agents yard 503 primarily good quality cattle, back 130 head on last week.
 
The buyers present demonstrated more enthusiasm to participate which saw light weight re-stocker steer weaners much improved by as much as 50c/kg selling from 308c to 428c/kg averaging 399c/kg with many of these heading to Northern NSW Tablelands country. Heifer counterparts couldnâ€™t maintain the rage making from 248c to 330c/kg. Best B muscle vealer to the trade made up to 345c/kg.
 
Medium weight yearling steers to back ground and feed saw positive sentiments of 5c to 30c/kg trading between 300c and 358c/kg, heavy weights over 400kg to lot feeders saw a big spike of 50c/kg on the back of much improved breed quality and sold from 310c to 376c/kg. Medium weight yearling heifers to the lot feeders remained firm making between 296c and 304c/kg. Prime heavy yearling and grown heifers in excess of 500kg sold from 324c to 336c/kg.
 
Most of the 60 cows penned were prime heavy 3 and 4 scores and sold 13c to 16c/kg dearer trading between 275c and 292c/kg. The best heavy Bull made 268c/kg weighing a substantial 1185kg.
 
Market Operator Angus Barlow.
